item.title: Welcome To Our Notes Vault
item.description: Get stated by heading to out Overview Here are the subjects we cover: English French Math.

item.title: L4 Homework
item.description: Textbook | p.388, 39012-16 The water depth in a harbor is 21m at high tide and 11m at low tide. One cycle is completed approximately every 12h. a) Find an equation for the water depth as a function of the time, hours, after low tide.

item.title: Notes
item.description: L1: Periodic Functions Notes What is a periodic function? A periodic function is a function in which the values of repeat at regular intervals of . Example The height of somebody who is taking a ride on a large Ferris wheel is periodic.

item.title: L1 - Pascal's Triangle
item.description: Notes What is Pascal's Triangle? Pascal’s Triangle is a triangle formed by adding adjacent numbers from the previous rows to form the numbers below them ...

item.title: L2 - Binomial Theory
item.description: Notes Binomial Observations Coefficients: When a binomial is raised to a power, it’s coefficient corresponds to the values of a specific row. Example *Corresponds to 4th row of pascals triangle Exponents: When a binomial is raised to a power, it’s exponents approaches towards, or recedes away from Example Binomial Theory a diminishes from n to 0 b increases from 0 until it reaches n r increases from 0 until it reaches n There are terms in total The coefficient of a term is given by The sum of the exponents of and is the row Questions Example 1 Tip Remember binomial theorem.

item.title: L3 - Arithmetic Sequences
item.description: Notes What is a sequence? A sequence is a list of numbers, figures, letters, etc. that are organized in a distinct and identifiable order Each number in a sequence is called a term.

item.title: L4 - Geometric Sequences
item.description: Notes What is a geometric sequence? A geometric sequence is a sequence in which the ratio between two consecutive terms is constant. We can always multiply/divide the same value to find the next term.
